text: Every pawnbroker shall, at the time of each loan, deliver to the person pawning or pledging any goods, article, or thing a memorandum or note, signed by him, containing the substance of the entry required to be made in his or her book by § 47-2884.11, excepting as to the description of the person and no charge shall be made or received by any pawnbroker for any such entry, memorandum, or note.
historical:
Prior Codifications

1981 Ed., § 2-1912.

1973 Ed., § 2-2012.

Effect of Amendments

D.C. Law 19-171 enacted into law Part B of subchapter IV of Chapter 28 of Title 47.

Legislative History of Laws

For history of Law 19-171, see notes under § 47-2884.01.

DC CODE § 47-2884.12

Current through December 11, 2012

title.text: Taxation, Licensing, Permits, Assessments, and Fees. (Refs & Annos)

heading.catch_text: Borrower to receive memorandum of loan transaction.
